sentence.Network_en: We will muddle through and just play it day by day.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们会应付过关的，就一天一天地演吧。

sentence.Network_en: We are beginning to muddle the extended royal family and the monarchy.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们开始混淆皇室大家庭和君主制这两个概念了。

sentence.Network_en: The laws led to confusion, muddle and years of delay.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些法律导致了困惑、混乱和数年的耽搁。

jx.jx_en_mean: To push on to a favorable outcome in a disorganized way.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 胡乱应付过去：以毫无组织的方式应付过去而得到一个还不错的结果

jx.jx_en_mean: cope more or less satisfactorily despite lack of expertise, planning, or equipment
jx.jx_cn_mean: 差强人意地应付，设法应付

lj.lj_ly: students are often left to muddle along.
lj.lj_ls: 学生们经常被丢在一边自己应付。

jx.jx_en_mean: confuse two or more things with each other

lj.lj_ly: the words seemed to have &B{got muddled up}.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'wallow in mud'): perhaps from Middle Dutch moddelen, frequentative of modden 'dabble in mud'; compare with mud. The sense 'confuse' was initially associated with alcoholic drink (late 17th cent.), giving rise to 'busy oneself in a confused way' and 'jumble up' (mid 19th cent.)

entry.def: If people or things are in a muddle, they are in a state of confusion or disorder.

example.ex: My thoughts are all in a muddle...
example.tran: 我的思维陷入一片混乱。

example.ex: We are going to get into a hopeless muddle.
example.tran: 我们就要陷入无可救药的混乱。

entry.def: If you muddle things or people, you get them mixed up, so that you do not know which is which.

example.ex: Already, one or two critics have begun to muddle the two names...
example.tran: 一两个评论家已经开始把这两个名字弄混了。

example.ex: We are beginning to muddle the extended royal family and the monarchy.
example.tran: 我们开始混淆皇室大家庭和君主制这两个概念了。

means.word_mean: 2. informal terms for a difficult situation;

sentences.sentence: "he made a muddle of his marriage"

auth_sentence.content: With these advances Mexico may muddle through this recession.
auth_sentence.res_content: With these advances Mexico may muddle through this recession.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: With these advances Mexico may muddle through this recession.

auth_sentence.content: You don't muddle through stamping out the Taliban.
auth_sentence.res_content: You don't muddle through stamping out the Taliban.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You don't muddle through stamping out the Taliban.

auth_sentence.content: This is more likely to muddle chronological understanding.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is more likely to muddle chronological understanding.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is more likely to muddle chronological understanding.

means.word_mean: 糊涂, 困惑, 茫然; 混乱, 杂乱, 乱七八糟

sentences.en: The papers are all in a muddle.

means.word_mean: 弄乱, 弄糟, 搅混, 混淆, 分不清

sentences.en: I wish you wouldn’t muddle my books.
sentences.cn: 我希望你别把我的书搞乱了。

sentences.en: We muddle along from day to day.
I won’t explain how this works now — it might muddle you up.
sentences.cn: 我现在先不讲解工作原理─ 那样会使你摸不着头脑的。

sentences.en: I got muddled up and took the wrong turning.
sentences.cn: 我稀里糊涂地拐错了弯。

sentences.en: He muddled up our passports and gave me back the wrong one.
sentences.cn: 他把我们的护照搞混了，把别人的发还给了我。

sentences.en: I keep muddling her up with her sister.
sentences.cn: 我总是把她当成她姐姐。

sentences.en: The money was muddled up with everything else in his pocket.
sentences.cn: 他衣兜里的钱和其他东西都混在一起了。

sentences.en: The kids have muddled up all the photos.
sentences.cn: 孩子们把照片全都翻得乱七八糟。
